intro: Senecio morisii, commonly known as Moris's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Senecio morisii is considered a rare and endangered species.
